Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Support for 2018 IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides support for about 20 U.S.-based students to participate in the 2018 IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE 2018). The primary goal of the conference is the sharing of scientific information and knowledge among participants. The supported students will have the opportunity to present their research, interact with other members of the international community, and start building their professional networks. Emphasis will be given to support a diverse group of students (research specialization, gender, ethnicity, undergraduates or graduates, etc.). Students' horizons will be broadened at a critical stage in their professional development. Supporting participation of U.S. students in the ICDE 2018 is important for the development of future researchers, practitioners and educators.

The ICDE conference will have a a multi-faceted program to include multiple keynote addresses, technical paper presentations, application track sessions, industry track sessions, demonstrations, a Ph.D. symposium, six workshops, tutorials, panels and poster sessions. All these activities will be opportunities for students to share their research work and knowledge with researchers from both academia and industry. New research topics will include AI interaction with database technology, Data Science, High-Performance Transaction Management, and Scalable Analytics.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of this award was to provide travel fellowships to a limited number of US students in order for them to attend the 2018 IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE).

The annual IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) addresses research issues in designing, building, managing, and evaluating advanced data-intensive systems and applications. It is a leading forum for researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and to exchange techniques, tools, and experiences. 2018 marked the 34th offerring of the conference; it was held in Paris, France, in April.

The selection of students to receive the travel fellowship was performed by a committee of five university professors from San Jose State University, the University of Massachusetts, the University of Pittsburgh, and the University of Southern California. Priority was given to supporting students who are either members of groups that are under-represented at the conference (e.g., undergraduate students, women, or members of other minorities) OR they would be attending the ICDE for the first time.

A total of 88 applications were received, out of which 16 students were selected to receive the travel fellowship.

All students were asked to provide testimonials so that we can evaluate the impact of the travel fellowship in their professional development. As evidence of the significant impact, we reproduce three such testimonials next.

"As a sophomore undergraduate, I never thought I would have gotten the opportunity to travel across the world to attend such a prestigious conference. Being my first ever conference, I was incredibly impressed not only by the city of Paris, but also with the fact that I was surrounded by such intellectual people. I found it incredibly easy having conversations with others and making friends. Moreover, the workshops and lectures I attended were very relevant to me as they were closely related to the research I am doing. The workshops gave me some inspiration for writing new papers and presenting my research in future conferences. All in all, I am so glad I attended to ICDE this year and I hope to attend many more conferences throughout the length of my education and career."

"First time attending conference, amazing experience, meeting lots of new friends from academia and industry. Hope to join for the next year."

"It was an eye opening experience as it was my first research conference. I was able to make a lot of connections and would not have been able to attend without this funding. I especially enjoyed the different keynotes and learning about different topics that are not available in my school. I will share my experience with as many people as possible."
